TopicTitle: How do you like a new website?

Articles.Content:
How do you like a new website?

Edit: I personally think, that it's good, but it's hard to find anything, when you are used to the old one.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T19:56:23Z" title="04/27/2015 07:56  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by bartekkru99**
its simple and easy to use i like it alot better than the last one it has its hidden humor in it to

This page: [https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/?page_id=13](https://kerbalspaceprogram.com/en/?page_id=13) Needs some work. The 'Wiki' part has the same description as the 'Forums' part, and the 'Mods' part has the wiki's description.

Also the Mods button links you to Curse instead of [Kerbalstuff.com](https://kerbalstuff.com) , so that's a bit weird.

EDIT: someone fixed the 'wiki' and 'mods' descriptions, so yay I helped ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T22:51:53Z" title="04/27/2015 10:51  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by r4pt0r**

I found it seeing if i could install the demo on this computer, and i was surpised and amazed by the new website! And we're getting a plushy Jebediah soon? Awesome! What's that image of an engine at the news blog post links? Maybe an ore powered engine or something? Looks like a de-leval nozzle.

Unfortunately, you can't just download the demo, you have to send an e-mail first, which complicates things somewhat.

I especially like that the site now includes a little blurb about Kerbal's history. They should have a picture of the Kerbo-Log and a brief description of it, as well.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T20:44:05Z" title="04/27/2015 08:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by GregroxMun**

The new website is a bit flashier and graphics-heavy compared to what I prefer, but it's not bad.

> 
> Also the Mods button links you to Curse instead of [Kerbalstuff.com](https://kerbalstuff.com) , so that's a bit weird.

This makes perfect sense, since Curse / CurseForge is the official KSP add-on repository, while KS is an unofficial alternative run privately.

A brief letter to SQUAD about the website:

Dear SQUAD,

If you scroll down to the bottom of the KSP website, there's a picture of a rather nasty-looking (sorry) rocket made in some older version of the game; it even has the red launch tower behind it. Also, there's clouds in the 'atmosphere' above it. Clearly, this isn't the version of KSP that we know and love.

I'd love to see Kerbal Space Program properly represented on the Kerbal Space Program website, which means a rocket made in a version of the game less than a year and a half old. Also, no clouds.

Would you mind at least considering these changes? Other than that, I love the new website and am looking forward to playing KSP 1.0.

(By the way, sorry if this has already been mentioned. I just got back from college and haven't had time to read the entirety of this thread yet.)

Sincerely,

Upsilon
It's new ; ) wich mean it's not old ; ) wich also mean it's different to what we were used too ; ) I feel like it won't be too hard for me to get used to this one ; )
